issue.title: Constructors for priority_queue taking allocators should call make_heap

discussion.p:
priority_queue constructors taking both Container and Alloc arguments should finish by calling make_heap, just as with the constructors that do not have allocator parameters.
The current reading of , if followed strictly, would effectively require calling code to ensure that the container argument is already a heap, which is probably not what was intended.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4527.

blockquote.pre: template <class Alloc> priority_queue(const Compare& compare, const Container& cont, const Alloc& a);

blockquote.p: -4- Effects: Initializes c with cont as the first argument and a as the second argument, and initializes comp with compare; calls make_heap(c.begin(), c.end(), comp).

blockquote.pre: template <class Alloc> priority_queue(const Compare& compare, Container&& cont, const Alloc& a);

blockquote.p: -5- Effects: Initializes c with std::move(cont) as the first argument and a as the second argument, and initializes comp with compare; calls make_heap(c.begin(), c.end(), comp).
